people across South Korea came together to commemorate the first Memorial Day for Japanese Forces comfort women victims

as far as why the date was picked on us 14th that's because it's a
27th anniversary of when kim hak-sun came forward and testified about her experience being a comfort woman
Now you may be wondering what is a comfort woman and also, why does Japan have a problem with this?
well if you didn't know between the
1800s on the end of World War two Japan controlled Korea and the other parts of East Asia to varying degrees
and during their wars of conquest
First against China and then nearly all of the region Japan made wide to use of comfort women, and that term was used by the Japanese
The time to really tone down what was actually happening
There and these comfort women were sex slaves in the Japanese military tricked coerced and often physically forced into brothels for their soldiers all over
Asia these brothels employed over 200,000 women and they were mostly from Korea but also from places like Taiwan the Philippines Indonesia
Mainland China two-thirds of which are thought to have died while being forced to work because of this past
Widespread abuse have come for women citizens from all of these countries just mentioned came out to observe the new South Korean holiday many holding
Photos of known comfort women and Seoul specifically was just full of people near a statue erected in front of the Japanese Embassy last year
As a memorial to comfort women,
in Taiwan we saw a private group unveiled their own

Japanese Embassy to demand that Japan better recognize their crimes and the Philippines groups did the same a demanded justice for the women abused there
